title: Retro script headline face in "Filter" magazine
content:
Does anybody know where I can find the typeface used as a headline in “Filter” magazine?  
It’s kind of a retro script font…

E-mail me if you know.

thanks!
author: odell

comments.content: Is [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528001154/http:/url/) the Filter magazine you’re talking about? ‘Cuz that’s no retro script…
I think we still need an image (.gif or .jpg) showing the type you want us to identify. The only online image I found for Filter magazine showed a blockish techno typeface, not a script.

It’s probably Eclat.

(just a guess - I’ve never seen or heard of Filter mag)

I think perhaps you mean [Poetica](http://web.archive.org/web/20050528001154/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/poetica/) from Adobe. It’s often used by Filter Magazine, assuming you and I are referring to the same one.
